text: will humanity survive in the same way
probably not I think the the next steps
in the possible human machine
integration are already kind of
happening with systems like deep
learning algorithms and other related
systems that we call AI deep learning is
really fascinating it's really undergone
a dramatic change in the last few years
because now we have deep learning
systems they're capable of doing things
like recognizing faces distinguishing
between male and female faces in images
and much more sophisticated things at a
level that humans can do and so what may
happen is we're going to offload some of
our tasks to machines and that could be
the beginning of something different
would be an evolutionary step that
really takes us in a radically different
path than any other life in the last
four billion years on this planet
because in a sense we're using a
different substrate of building things
out of organic chemistry we'd be
building things out of software we'd be
building things embedded in and silicon
and other electronic devices and that's
really interesting we may be witnessing
the first new origin event first there
was the origin of life now is perhaps
the origin of something new but maybe a
mingling of the official with the
natural and will humanity survive in the
same way or probably not because
evolution just keeps going and going and
there's nothing that says modern humans
are going to be around forever we may
change into something else in some way I
think we've already begun that process
if I pick up my smartphone it really is
an extension not just my body now but of
my mind it's the way I find information
it's a way that I connect other human
so I think this idea that we might merge
with robots in the future millage with
our machines is a really fascinating and
important one but it may happen in
subtle ways and it may happen in ways
that we haven't expected yet think the
smartphone the internet our integration
with social media is a good example of
how perhaps that begins to start
